subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Variability Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial reactive oxygen species (ROS) production causing oxidative damage, mitochondrial permeability transition pore opening, and programmed cell death driving aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial free radical (ROS) production causing oxidative damage to mitochondrial components and driving aging.
Describes mitochondrial ROS generation from electron transport chain dysfunction leading to oxidative damage and aging.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS production induced by ionizing radiation causing oxidative damage and aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial oxidative stress and redox imbalance from excess ROS causing aging-related damage.
Describes increased mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage in skeletal muscle aging and type 1 diabetes.
Links mitochondrial mutation-driven ROS production to stem cell dysfunction and aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial oxidative damage caused by lipid peroxidation product malondialdehyde (MDA) and ROS toxicity.
Describes lipofuscin-bound iron catalyzing ROS production and oxidative damage, linking mitochondrial-lysosomal axis to aging.
Focuses on impaired mitochondrial quality control (fusion/fission, mitophagy) and protein turnover causing mitochondrial dysfunction in muscle aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial quality control impairment and ferritinophagy dysregulation leading to mitochondrial damage and muscle aging.
Describes decline of mitochondrial Lon protease, a key quality control protease, causing accumulation of damaged proteins and mitochondrial dysfunction.
Focuses on age-related decline in Lon protease activity impairing mitochondrial protein quality control and contributing to aging.
Proposes mitochondrial senescence due to quality control failure and persistent dysfunctional mitochondria driving chronic aging-like pathology.
Describes suppression of complex I in oocytes to reduce ROS and activate mitochondrial unfolded protein response, a quality control mechanism.
Focuses on mitochondrial energy metabolism regulation via AMPK/ACC1 pathway and acetyl-CoA metabolism affecting aging and neurodegeneration.
Describes mitochondrial energy metabolism impairment causing neuronal excitotoxicity and neurodegeneration.
Focuses on oxidative damage to alpha-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase complex impairing brain energy metabolism and driving neurodegeneration.
Links mitochondrial DNA damage accumulation to brain aging and neurocognitive impairment, emphasizing mitochondrial dysfunction in brain.
Describes mitochondrial bioenergetics, ROS production, and mitochondrial-nuclear interactions influencing aging and life-history traits.
Focuses on mitochondrial protein synthesis efficiency and accuracy affecting oxidative phosphorylation and mitochondrial-nuclear communication in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Variability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mtDNA haplotype variability influencing mitochondrial function, ROS production, and aging-related joint damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Variability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of somatic mtDNA mutations causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Variability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes progressive accumulation and clonal expansion of mtDNA deletions impairing mitochondrial function and driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Variability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mtDNA damage and substitution rates to lifespan and aging, emphasizing ROS-induced mtDNA damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Variability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits mtDNA mutation accumulation from ROS as a causal factor in aging with clonal expansion of mutations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Variability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes somatic mtDNA mutations accumulation causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging, supported by mutator mouse models.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Variability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA mutation burden causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging phenotypes, independent of oxidative stress increase.
